newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil AgMin sees 26.45 mln 96/97 soy crop - report.
newsitem.headline: Brazil AgMin sees 26.45 mln 96/97 soy crop - report.

text.p: Brazil's Agriculture Ministry forecast a record 1996/97 soybean harvest of 26.453 million tonnes, financial daily Gaceta Mercantil said.
"The record harvest is the result of a rise in productivity and a climate favourable to the development of the crop," the newspaper said.
A spokeswoman for the ministry declined to confirm the figure, adding the forecast would be published March 12.
"That is not an official figure. We are finalising the forecast," she told Reuters.
Planted area should rise to 11.35 million hectares, up 6.3 percent on 1995/96, Gaceta said.
The key growing state of Rio Grande do Sul was set to produce 5.7 million tonnes of soybeans with an average productivity of 1,950 kilos per hectare.
But Parana, despite having a lower planted area, was set to remain the largest producer with a harvest of 6.6 million tonnes, the newspaper said.
